page.title: 05Education.
page.content: The area is served by {Slaley County {First School,}which is a modern building of three classrooms and a hall, surrounded by ample grounds and playing fields. The school identifies closely with the community. Children join a {nursery class}held in the mornings when they are three years, transferring to school when they are 4+. The headmaster has full-time responsibility for a class of 20 and there are two other classes of 18 and 14. The school serves the general area of Slaley, Blanchland, Healey and Minsteracres, children beyond 2 miles being transported by minibus. Children from the school usually transfer to {Corbridge County Middle School}at 9+ and then to the{Queen Elizabeth High {School,}Hexham at the age of 13+.
